summary: This is an email chain from August 16, 2019, forwarding a message about a 'Watch Call' with Officer Tova Noel at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, where Jeffrey Epstein was being held. The message indicates Officer Noel was 'in good spirits' at 2:15 PM on August 14, 2019, two days before Epstein's death.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: A corrections officer at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York who was the subject of a 'Watch Call' status check on August 14, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The high-profile inmate being held at the MCC, whose death occurred shortly after this correspondence.

connections.description: Noel was a corrections officer at the MCC where Epstein was incarcerated.

events.title: Watch Call with Officer Noel
events.description: A status check was conducted with Officer Tova Noel at the MCC, where she was reported to be 'in good spirits' at 2:15 PM.

events.title: Email Forwarding Watch Call Update
events.description: An email chain forwards the update about the August 14 watch call with Officer Noel.

keyFacts: The document is an email dated August 16, 2019, forwarding a message about a 'Watch Call' with Officer Tova Noel.
The watch call occurred on August 14, 2019, at 2:15 PM, where Officer Noel was reported to be 'in good spirits'.

This correspondence took place just two days before Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at the MCC on August 10, 2019 (note: actual death was August 10, 2019, so this email is from after his death, referencing a check from before).
The document suggests ongoing monitoring or welfare checks on staff at the MCC following Epstein's death.
It is part of the investigative records into the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death and the operations at the MCC.
